p: Morphological techniques were combined with DNA barcoding to determine the presence and distribution of mosquito species in Ghana. The high density and distribution of Culex and Aedes mosquitoes in Ghana raise concerns about the possible risk of arboviral outbreaks [ 55]. The detection of Aedes hirsutus, which has been implicated as a vector of ZIKV [ 56], is an example of the diversity of possible vectors of arboviruses in Ghana. The detection of Aedes lilii in Ghana, the non-vector cryptic species of the yellow fever vector Aedes bromeliae, affirms the need to combine molecular techniques with morphological identification when using entomological surveillance to estimate the risk of outbreaks [ 57, 58].
